title: Prioritized Interventions for Neurodevelopmental Symptoms — Knowledge Base (Merged)

notes: View symptoms as downstream signals of upstream imbalances.
Start with least invasive, system-level interventions before targeted/complex care.
Use genetics as a vulnerability map; environment & nutrition can modulate expression.

prioritized_interventions.name: Methylation support
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Supports neurotransmitter synthesis and DNA repair; addresses folate/B12 pathway vulnerabilities including CFD.
prioritized_interventions.safety_notes: Dosing and form selection require clinician guidance.

prioritized_interventions.name: Mitochondrial support
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Improves cellular ATP availability for energy-intensive language acquisition.

foundation_layer_recommendations: Change the diet (remove gluten, casein, sugar, additives, GMOs)

prioritized_interventions.name: Change the diet (remove gluten, casein, sugar, additives, GMOs)
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Reduces food-driven gut inflammation and permeability that can impair cognition.

prioritized_interventions.name: Thyroid function assessment
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Thyroid hormones are master regulators of neurodevelopment; screen for hypo/autoimmunity.

prioritized_interventions.name: Magnesium + gut support
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Magnesium supports GABAergic calming; probiotics address dysbiosis and serotonin-melatonin axis.

prioritized_interventions.name: Vitamin D optimization
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Vitamin D receptors in sleep-regulatory regions; deficiency correlates with poor sleep quality.

prioritized_interventions.name: GI tract cleanup (antimicrobials, anti-parasite, gut-healing diet) + Change the diet
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Unrecognized GI pain and inflammation frequently drive severe irritability/aggression.

prioritized_interventions.name: Electrolytes & trace minerals (Magnesium emphasis)
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Supports conversion of glutamate to GABA; calms neuromuscular irritability.

prioritized_interventions.name: Prebiotics & Probiotics
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Targets gut-brain axis and low-grade inflammation impacting mood and anxiety.

prioritized_interventions.name: PANS/PANDAS workup (if acute onset)
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Autoimmune neuropsychiatric syndrome post-infection requires urgent, distinct medical care.

prioritized_interventions.name: Change the diet & Prebiotics/Probiotics
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Reduces inflammatory load and supports neurotransmitter balance affecting sensory gating.

prioritized_interventions.name: Magnesium + Vitamin B6 (P5P)
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Cofactors for GABA synthesis and NMDA modulation; may reduce hyperexcitability.

prioritized_interventions.name: GI motility support
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Postural adaptation to abdominal pain/impaction is common; resolve pain first.

prioritized_interventions.name: Electrolytes & trace minerals (Magnesium, Zinc)
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Addresses neuromuscular irritability and motor control co-factors.

prioritized_interventions.name: GI tract cleanup / Yeast investigation
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Candida/pathogen metabolites and GI discomfort can escalate self-regulatory behaviors.

prioritized_interventions.name: Mineral deficiency assessment
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Deficiencies impact neurotransmission and restlessness.

prioritized_interventions.name: Low-glutamate diet + GABA support
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Targets excitation-inhibition imbalance implicated in repetitive verbalization.

prioritized_interventions.name: Investigate low cholesterol
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Cholesterol supports myelination and membrane signaling; low levels correlate with neuroinstability.

prioritized_interventions.name: Address zinc deficiency
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Zinc supports gustatory function; deficiency alters taste and perpetuates selectivity.

prioritized_interventions.name: Treat GI discomfort
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Food-pain association drives refusal; address underlying pathology.

prioritized_interventions.name: Mineral deficiency assessment
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Pica frequently resolves when iron/zinc deficiencies are corrected.

prioritized_interventions.name: Gut pathogen screening
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Pathogens can alter cravings and worsen malabsorption.

prioritized_interventions.name: Speech & language therapy (comprehension-focused)
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Bridges decoding-comprehension gap using visual strengths to teach meaning and pragmatics.

prioritized_interventions.name: Occupational therapy (sensory integration)
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Addresses sensory regulation and motor planning to support engagement.

prioritized_interventions.name: Mitochondrial support
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Supports ATP generation in energy-demanding muscle tissue.

prioritized_interventions.name: Carnitine supplementation
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Facilitates fatty acid transport into mitochondria; improves strength/endurance.

prioritized_interventions.name: Change the diet (remove dyes & common allergens)
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Reduces neuro-irritants and low-grade inflammation that impair attention.

prioritized_interventions.name: Increase omega-3s / good fats
prioritized_interventions.rationale: Supports membrane fluidity, neurotransmission, and anti-inflammatory signaling.

triage_rules: If Anxiety/OCD has abrupt, severe onset post-infection: prioritize PANS/PANDAS workup immediately.
Before behavior-focused plans, rule out pain (especially GI), sleep deficit, and mineral deficiencies.
When initiating multi-supplement protocols, add one change at a time; monitor response for 1–3 weeks.
